title: The Crown's Matt Smith and Claire Foy reunite for new play Lungs
text:
Matt Smith and Claire Foy first worked together on 2016’s The Crown SE1 (Picture: Dan Wooller/REX/10450852x)

The Crown’s Matt Smith and Claire Foy are proving to be the ultimate work husband and wife – after starring together in new play Lungs.

The actors debuted the production at London’s Old Vic theatre last night, before stepping out for the glamorous after party.

The old friends first worked together on Netflix’s iconic royal family-inspired series, the first series of which dropped in 2016.

Matt, 36, and Claire, 35, played Prince Phillip and Queen Elizabeth on the programme – with Claire recently replaced by Oscar-winning star of The Favourite, Olivia Colman.

Tobias Menzies, meanwhile, is taking over Matt’s role.

In the revival of Lungs, a two-person play by Duncan Macmillan, the pair portray a couple debating whether to have a baby in an age of climate change.

Matt and Claire share a joke at the party at The Old Vic (Picture: Rex Features)

Matt and Claire – who attended the after-party in matching black outfits – have so far won positive reviews for their performance.

In real life, Claire is a mum to daughter Ivy Rose Moore, with her ex-husband Stephen Campbell Moore.

Claire and Matt in the Crown (Picture: Rex Features)

Matt, meanwhile, is in a relationship with actress Lily James, star of movies like the Cinderella live-action remake and Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again.

Famous faces who attended last night’s performance included Olympic diver Tom Daley and his screenwriter husband Dustin Lance Black, plus Four Weddings And A Funeral actor Simon Callow.

Olivia Colman recently addressed replacing Claire on The Crown, joking that the experience was ‘horrendous.’

‘Everyone loves Claire Foy,’ she told Entertainment Weekly. ‘So I have got the worst job in the world at the moment.’

She furthermore added: ‘The first week, I did feel myself trying to do Claire impressions. “What would she have done?”’
